generalOptions.name: accountIndex
generalOptions.description: The index in the derivation path related with the account to use

generalOptions.name: json
generalOptions.description: If provided all the output will be in JSON format

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List all the pre-configured Nevermined networks
subcommands.details: The `ncli` has a pre-configured list of Nevermined environments in different networks. This command lists basic information about all available Nevermined environments.

optionalArguments.name: hideInternal
optionalArguments.description: If true it doesn't show internal Nevermined networks

subcommands.name: status
subcommands.description: List all the information about a Nevermined deployment
subcommands.details: If the `ncli` is connected to a Nevermined network correctly this command will return information about that specific network. This will include data about the contracts (version, addresses, etc), Nevermined Node, Marketplace API.

subcommands.name: get-config
subcommands.description: Get all the Governance configuration about a Nevermined environment
subcommands.details: If the `ncli` is connected to a Nevermined network correctly this command will return information about all the governance parameters related to a Nevermined deployment.

subcommands.name: set-config [parameter] [newValue]
subcommands.description: Allows the governor account to modify the configuration of a running Nevermined blockchain environment. The fees need to be applied with 4 decimal numbers, where 25000 represents a 2.5% fee
subcommands.details: If the `ncli` is connected to a Nevermined network correctly this command will modify the on-chain configuration of a deployment. This function can only be executed by a `governor` account.

positionalArguments.name: parameter
positionalArguments.description: the name of the governance parameter to configure. Existing options: 'fees' OR 'governor'

commands.name: accounts
commands.description: Management of accounts and the funds associated to them

subcommands.name: new
subcommands.description: Creates a new account locally
subcommands.details: Nevermined interacts with EVM compatible blockchain networks. To interact with them a user needs to have compatible local credentials (BIP-44). This command creates a local wallet that is Etherum compatible and can be used to interact with Nevermined contracts.

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: The json encrypted file destination. By default ./account.json

optionalArguments.name: password
optionalArguments.description: Password to encrypt the new wallet

subcommands.name: list
subcommands.description: List all accounts related with your credentials.
subcommands.details: To work prorperly the `ncli` needs to use a wallet to interact with the blockchain network where the Nevermined Smart Contracts are deployed. This wallet is given to the `ncli` with the **seed phrase** exported into the `SEED_WORDS` environment variable. This command list some of the accounts derived from the seed words given by the user.

optionalArguments.name: nftTokenAddress
optionalArguments.description: Load NFT (ERC-721) inventory as well

subcommands.name: balance [address]
subcommands.description: Get the balance of a specific address
subcommands.details: Given the public address of an account, this command gets the balance of the Native token where the `ncli` is connected. This is typically `ETH` in Ethereum networks, `MATIC` in Polygon networks, etc.

positionalArguments.name: address
positionalArguments.description: The address of the account to retrieve the balance

optionalArguments.name: nftTokenAddress
optionalArguments.description: Load NFT (ERC-721) inventory as well

subcommands.name: fund [account]
subcommands.description: Funds an account with ERC20 tokens on a testnet
subcommands.details: In the test environments all tokens lack real value. Typically in Nevermined you need to use different type of tokens. The Native token (`ETH`, `MATIC`, etc) to pay for the gas resulting to write into a blockchain network, and optionally with a `ERC20` token to do some payments. This command allows to get some funds in a testnet environment allowing to a user to run different processes on a testnet. This command will not work in production environments where the tokens have actual value.

commands.name: assets
commands.description: Allows to register and manage assets in a Nevermined network

subcommands.name: register-asset
subcommands.description: Register a new asset
subcommands.details: This command registers a new asset on the Nevermined network. This registered asset is attached to an access service, allowing paying users to access the files attached to the asset.
examples: ncli assets register-asset --name 'My cool artwork' --author 'John Doe' --price '1' --urls https://www.diarioel9dejulio.com.ar/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Francisco_de_Goya_Saturno_devorando_a_su_hijo_1819-1823.jpg --contentType text/plain

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The asset name

optionalArguments.name: author
optionalArguments.description: The author of the asset

optionalArguments.name: dateCreated
optionalArguments.description: When the asset was created

optionalArguments.name: tags
optionalArguments.description: Comma separated list of tags

optionalArguments.name: access
optionalArguments.description: The type of access control associated to the asset. If `direct` the asset will allow direct payment, if `susbcription` it will allow access via NFT susbcription, if both it will configure both methods.

optionalArguments.name: price
optionalArguments.description: The asset price

optionalArguments.name: urls
optionalArguments.description: The asset urls. It can be a comma separated list of urls for multiple files

optionalArguments.name: contentType
optionalArguments.description: Files content type. Example: application/csv

optionalArguments.name: license
optionalArguments.description: The asset license

optionalArguments.name: password
optionalArguments.description: The password for encrypted files

optionalArguments.name: publishMetadata
optionalArguments.description: Allows to store the metadata in the Metadata API only (metadata-api) or in IPFS too (passing ipfs as value here).

optionalArguments.name: assetType
optionalArguments.description: The type of the asset to register

optionalArguments.name: subscriptionNFT
optionalArguments.description: The address of the subscription NFT used to protect the access to the asset

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: register-algorithm
subcommands.description: Register a new algorithm
subcommands.details: This command registers a new algorithm on the Nevermined network. The algorithm can be the representation of a Notebook, python script, etc. This registered asset is attached to an access service, allowing paying users to access the files attached to the asset.
examples: ncli assets register-algorithm --name 'Test Algorithm' --author 'John Doe' --price 0 --language python --entrypoint 'python word_count.py' --container python:3.8-alpine --urls https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 --contentType text/plain

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The asset name

optionalArguments.name: author
optionalArguments.description: The author of the asset

optionalArguments.name: dateCreated
optionalArguments.description: When the asset was created

optionalArguments.name: tags
optionalArguments.description: Comma separated list of tags

optionalArguments.name: access
optionalArguments.description: The type of access control associated to the asset. If `direct` the asset will allow direct payment, if `susbcription` it will allow access via NFT susbcription, if both it will configure both methods.

optionalArguments.name: price
optionalArguments.description: The asset price

optionalArguments.name: urls
optionalArguments.description: The asset urls. It can be a comma separated list of urls for multiple files

optionalArguments.name: contentType
optionalArguments.description: Files content type. Example: application/csv

optionalArguments.name: license
optionalArguments.description: The asset license

optionalArguments.name: language
optionalArguments.description: The programing language of the algorithm

optionalArguments.name: entrypoint
optionalArguments.description: The entrypoint for running the algorithm. Example: python word_count.py

optionalArguments.name: container
optionalArguments.description: The docker container where the algorithm can be executed. Example: python:3.8-alpine

optionalArguments.name: publishMetadata
optionalArguments.description: Allows to store the metadata in the Metadata API only (metadata-api) or in IPFS too (passing ipfs as value here).

optionalArguments.name: assetType
optionalArguments.description: The type of the asset to register

optionalArguments.name: subscriptionNFT
optionalArguments.description: The address of the subscription NFT used to protect the access to the asset

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: register-service
subcommands.description: Register a new web service
subcommands.details: This command registers a new web service on the Nevermined network. The service can be the representation of any regular Web Service (REST, JSON-RPC, etc).
examples: ncli assets  --name 'My Open AI' --author 'John Doe' --subscriptionNFT 0x736DCC96D89cB2F9E2316cD826668f4E1c4861B0 --urls https://api.openai.com/v1/completions --authToken sk-xxxxxx

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The asset name

optionalArguments.name: author
optionalArguments.description: The author of the asset

optionalArguments.name: dateCreated
optionalArguments.description: When the asset was created

optionalArguments.name: tags
optionalArguments.description: Comma separated list of tags

optionalArguments.name: access
optionalArguments.description: The type of access control associated to the asset. If `direct` the asset will allow direct payment, if `susbcription` it will allow access via NFT susbcription, if both it will configure both methods.

optionalArguments.name: price
optionalArguments.description: The asset price

optionalArguments.name: urls
optionalArguments.description: The asset urls. It can be a comma separated list of urls for multiple files

optionalArguments.name: authToken
optionalArguments.description: Authorization token of the service

optionalArguments.name: publishMetadata
optionalArguments.description: Allows to store the metadata in the Metadata API only (metadata-api) or in IPFS too (passing ipfs as value here).

optionalArguments.name: assetType
optionalArguments.description: The type of the asset to register

optionalArguments.name: subscriptionNFT
optionalArguments.description: The address of the subscription NFT used to protect the access to the asset

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: import [metadata]
subcommands.description: Import an asset using the metadata in JSON format
subcommands.details: An asset in the Nevermined network can be described by different level of metadata (title, description, tags, etc). This command registers a new asset importing all this metadata from a JSON file, instead of adding all the information in the command line.

positionalArguments.name: metadata
positionalArguments.description: The path to the JSON file including the asset metadata

optionalArguments.name: encrypt
optionalArguments.description: Use encrypted service endpoint

optionalArguments.name: publishMetadata
optionalArguments.description: Allows to store the metadata in the Metadata API only (metadata-api) or in IPFS too (passing ipfs as value here).

optionalArguments.name: access
optionalArguments.description: The type of access control associated to the asset. If `direct` the asset will allow direct payment, if `susbcription` it will allow access via NFT susbcription, if both it will configure both methods.

subcommands.name: search [query]
subcommands.description: Searching for assets in a Nevermined environment
subcommands.details: All user metadata for registering assets in Nevermined can be searched and indexed later. Typically different assets can be organized in independent Marketplaces grouped by topic or domain. This command allows to query one of the Marketplace environments searching for data using a query provided by the user.

optionalArguments.name: offset
optionalArguments.description: The number of elements to obtain from the search query

optionalArguments.name: page
optionalArguments.description: The page to show

optionalArguments.name: onlyMetadata
optionalArguments.description: True if we only want to get metadata

subcommands.name: query [query]
subcommands.description: Searching for assets in a Nevermined environment using Elasticsearch query
subcommands.details: All user metadata for registering assets in Nevermined can be searched and indexed later. Typically different assets can be organized in independent Marketplaces grouped by topic or domain. This command allows to query one of the Marketplace environments searching for data using a query provided by the user.

optionalArguments.name: offset
optionalArguments.description: The number of elements to obtain from the search query

optionalArguments.name: page
optionalArguments.description: The page to show

optionalArguments.name: onlyMetadata
optionalArguments.description: True if we only want to get metadata

subcommands.name: download [did]
subcommands.description: Download an asset owned by me
subcommands.details: When a user publishes content on Nevermined this command downloads the files attached to that asset without going through the service agreements (payment).

optionalArguments.name: fileIndex
optionalArguments.description: The index of the file to retrieve in the DDO

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: Local path where the asset files will be downloaded

subcommands.name: order [did]
subcommands.description: Order an asset given a DID
subcommands.details: This method makes the payment and retrieve a serviceAgreementId that can be used later or to download the files attached to the asset

optionalArguments.name: password
optionalArguments.description: Password for receiving encrypted files

subcommands.name: get [did]
subcommands.description: Order & download or download directly a previously purchased asset
subcommands.details: This commands is the best entry point to access the files attached to a Nevermined asset. Depending on the parameters provided, it allows to order and download the files of an asset, or if this was already purchased, provides the service agreement to download them.

optionalArguments.name: agreementId
optionalArguments.description: Agreement Id of a previously purchased asset. If not given a new purchase will be executed

optionalArguments.name: fileIndex
optionalArguments.description: The index of the file to retrieve in the DDO

optionalArguments.name: password
optionalArguments.description: Password for receiving encrypted files

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: Local path where the asset files will be downloaded

subcommands.name: resolve [did]
subcommands.description: Resolve an asset metadata using a given DID
subcommands.details: An asset registered in Nevermined is represented by 2 parts. Metadata stored in a Marketplace and the reference in the Smart Contract. The key to resolve this metadata in a specific marketplace is a unique Decentralize Identifier (DID) for the asset. This command uses that DID to resolve the Metadata in a Marketplace associated to the asset.

subcommands.name: retire [did]
subcommands.description: Retire an asset using a given DID
subcommands.details: This command allows to retire an asset from a Marketplace. Only the owner of the asset has the permissions to execute this sucessfully.

commands.name: agreements
commands.description: Get information about the Service Execution Agreements

subcommands.name: list [did]
subcommands.description: Lists all agreements for given DID
subcommands.details: For an asset published in Nevermined, this command returns all agreements created as a result of different users interacting with the asset. Typically this will include purchases made by users.

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID to list the agreements for

subcommands.name: show [agreementId]
subcommands.description: Shows details about an agreement
subcommands.details: An agreement in Nevermined keeps track of the state of the different conditions that need to be fulfilled in order to facilitate some service (access, download, computation, etc). Given a `serviceAgreementId` this command returns all the on-chain information referring to the state of that agreement. The conditions associated with it and their status.

commands.name: provenance
commands.description: Get information about the provenance information stored into Nevermined

subcommands.name: register [did]
subcommands.description: Registers a provenance event associated to a DID
subcommands.details: The Nevermined provenance record keeps track of all the individual events happening in the assets registered in the Nevermined network. This command registers a new event in that record.

optionalArguments.name: method
optionalArguments.description: The W3C Provenance event to report (wasGeneratedBy, used, wasDerivedFrom, wasAssociatedWith, ActedOnBehalf)

optionalArguments.name: agentId
optionalArguments.description: The address of the agent doing the action/activity

optionalArguments.name: activityId
optionalArguments.description: The identifier of the activity to register

optionalArguments.name: relatedDid
optionalArguments.description: The additional DID related with the activity (if any)

optionalArguments.name: agentInvolved
optionalArguments.description: The address of the additional agent (if any) involved with the activity

optionalArguments.name: signature
optionalArguments.description: The signature associated to the provenance event

optionalArguments.name: attributes
optionalArguments.description: Additional attributes to register associated with the activity

subcommands.name: history [did]
subcommands.description: Given a DID it gets all the provenance history for that asset
subcommands.details: An asset can be associated with multiple provenance events. This relates to how that asset was used and by whom in a Nevermined network. This command fetches that information from the on-chain provenance track record.

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID to list the provenance events

subcommands.name: inspect [provenanceId]
subcommands.description: It fetches the on-chain information regarding a Provenance Id event
subcommands.details: A `provenanceId` represents a unique event referring to a DID. This command obtain all the existing information of that event.

commands.name: nfts721
commands.description: Create and manage NFTs (ERC-721) attached to Nevermined assets

subcommands.name: deploy [abiPath]
subcommands.description: It deploys a new NFT (ERC-721) contract
subcommands.details: A Smart Contract is represented by an ABI file that includes the definition of it interfaces and the bytecode of the contract. Having that file, this command allows to deploy a new instance of a ERC-721 contract in the network where the `ncli` is connected. As a result the `ncli` will return the address where the contract was deployed allowing further interaction with it.

positionalArguments.name: abiPath
positionalArguments.description: The path to the ABI representing the ERC-721 contract

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract name

optionalArguments.name: symbol
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract symbol

optionalArguments.name: uri
optionalArguments.description: The nft metadata uri

optionalArguments.name: cap
optionalArguments.description: The max number of tokens created in this NFT contract. If 0 means unlimitted

optionalArguments.name: approve
optionalArguments.description: A list of addresses to be approved to manage the NFT contract

optionalArguments.name: addOperator
optionalArguments.description: If true adds the Nevermined Transfer condition with permissions to mint NFTs

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: clone [nftAddress]
subcommands.description: It clones an existing NFT (ERC-721) contract
subcommands.details: Nevermined Smart Contracts are deployed in a blockchain, with this command it's possible to clone the implementation of an already deployed Smart Contract. The new contract cloned will be owned by the user doing that clonning action.

positionalArguments.name: nftAddress
positionalArguments.description: The address of an already deployed ERC-721 NFT contract

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract name

optionalArguments.name: symbol
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract symbol

optionalArguments.name: uri
optionalArguments.description: The nft metadata uri

optionalArguments.name: cap
optionalArguments.description: The max number of tokens created in this NFT contract. If 0 means unlimitted

optionalArguments.name: operators
optionalArguments.description: A list of addresses to be approved to operate the NFT contract

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: create [nftAddress]
subcommands.description: Registers a new asset and associates a ERC-721 NFT to it
subcommands.details: Having a previously deployed ERC-721 NFT contract, this command registers a new asset that allows the publisher to provide access to some exclusive contents when users purchase the NFT.
examples: ncli nfts721 create 0xDef6F10d641BC9d8039365B27f4DF2C5F5eeb041 --name 'My NFT' --author 'John Doe' --price 1 --urls https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 --contentType text/plain

positionalArguments.name: nftAddress
positionalArguments.description: The address of the NFT (ERC-721) contract

optionalArguments.name: metadata
optionalArguments.description: The path to the json file describing the NFT metadata

optionalArguments.name: nftMetadata
optionalArguments.description: The url (HTTP, IPFS, etc) including the NFT Metadata required by some marketplaces like OpenSea'

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The asset name

optionalArguments.name: author
optionalArguments.description: The author of the file/s

optionalArguments.name: urls
optionalArguments.description: The asset urls. It can be a comma separated list of urls for multiple files.

optionalArguments.name: providers
optionalArguments.description: Public addresses of Node providers that user delegates some permissions.

optionalArguments.name: services
optionalArguments.description: The list of services attached to the asset

optionalArguments.name: license
optionalArguments.description: The asset license (Creative Commons, etc)

optionalArguments.name: price
optionalArguments.description: The NFT price

optionalArguments.name: preMint
optionalArguments.description: If true the NFTs will be minted during creation

optionalArguments.name: type
optionalArguments.description: The type of asset to register (dataset, algorithm, workflow, container, subscription)

optionalArguments.name: transfer
optionalArguments.description: It allows to transfer a NFT when purchased or mint

optionalArguments.name: duration
optionalArguments.description: If the asset refers to a subscription, this parameter define the duration of that subscription in blocks

optionalArguments.name: royalties
optionalArguments.description: The royalties (between 0 and 100%) to reward to the original creator in the secondary market.

optionalArguments.name: publishMetadata
optionalArguments.description: Allows to store the metadata in the Metadata API only (metadata-api) or in IPFS too (passing ipfs as value here).

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: show [did]
subcommands.description: Retrieves information about a NFT
subcommands.details: For a given DID and NFT (ERC-721) this command displays some information about it

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID associated with the NFT

optionalArguments.name: nftAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the NFT (ERC-721) contract

optionalArguments.name: abiPath
optionalArguments.description: The path to the ABI representing the ERC-721 contract

optionalArguments.name: is721
optionalArguments.description: Is a ERC-721 NFT

optionalArguments.name: show1155
optionalArguments.description: Show if there are any NFT ERC-1155 attached to the DID

subcommands.name: hold [did]
subcommands.description: It checks if an address is a holder of the NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to check if an address is a holder of a specific NFT wrapped by a Nevermined DID

optionalArguments.name: address
optionalArguments.description: The address of the account to validate as holder

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: balance [nftAddress]
subcommands.description: It gets the balance of a NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to check if an address is a holder of a specific NFT wrapped by a Nevermined DID

optionalArguments.name: address
optionalArguments.description: The address of the account to get the balance

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: mint [did]
subcommands.description: Mints a ERC-721 NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to the owner of an asset to mint a ERC-721 based NFT

optionalArguments.name: nftAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the NFT (ERC-721) contract

optionalArguments.name: uri
optionalArguments.description: The token uri for the Asset Metadata

optionalArguments.name: receiver
optionalArguments.description: The address of the receiver of the NFT, if not given will be the minter address

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: burn [did] [nftAddress]
subcommands.description: It Burns a ERC-721 NFT
subcommands.details: It allows to a ERC-721 NFT owner to burn it

positionalArguments.name: nftAddress
positionalArguments.description: The address of the NFT (ERC-721) contract

optionalArguments.name: tokenId
optionalArguments.description: The token Id to burn

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: order [did]
subcommands.description: Orders an NFT (ERC-721) by paying for it to the escrow
subcommands.details: When a user orders an asset attached to a NFT, this command purchases that NFT and transfers it to the wallet completing that purchase. This will allow later on to get access to the exclusive contents attached to the asset demonstrating the possesion of that NFT.

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: claim [agreementId]
subcommands.description: It allows to claim a NFT (ERC-721) to the account of the buyer
subcommands.details: This command requires a valid `serviceAgreementId` and the `sellerAddress` that demonstrates that an asset was bought. The asset is then transferred to the buyer's account.

positionalArguments.name: agreementId
positionalArguments.description: The identifier of the agreement created by the buyer

optionalArguments.name: sellerAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the seller (0x123..)

optionalArguments.name: buyerAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the account who will receive the NFT

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: access [did]
subcommands.description: It allows to download the contents associated to a NFT if the user is a holder
subcommands.details: Providing a `DID` this command will allow to download the file contents associated to a DID that has a NFT (ERC-721) as access control mechanism. If the account of the user executing this command hold the NFT, it will be able to download the files.

optionalArguments.name: agreementId
optionalArguments.description: The identifier of the agreement created by the buyer

optionalArguments.name: seller
optionalArguments.description: The address of the seller (0x123..)

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: The destination of the files downloaded

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: download [did]
subcommands.description: As NFT holder this allows to download the files associated to a NFT
subcommands.details: This command will allow to download the file contents associated to a DID that has a NFT (ERC-721) as access control mechanism. If the account of the user executing this command holds the NFT, it will download the files.

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID asset identifier that works as tokenId for the NFT

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: The destination of the files

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: get-jwt [did]
subcommands.description: It returns a JWT access token related with a subscription NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to get a JWT token that gives access through the proxy to certain services that only can be accessed via subscription NFT

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID of the service to be accessed

commands.name: nfts1155
commands.description: Create and manage NFTs (ERC-1155) attached to Nevermined assets

subcommands.name: deploy [abiPath]
subcommands.description: It deploys a new NFT (ERC-1155) contract
subcommands.details: A Smart Contract is represented by an ABI file that includes the definition of it interfaces and the bytecode of the contract. Having that file, this command allows to deploy a new instance of a ERC-721 contract in the network where the `ncli` is connected. As a result the `ncli` will return the address where the contract was deployed allowing further interaction with it.

positionalArguments.name: abiPath
positionalArguments.description: The path to the ABI representing the ERC-1155 contract

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract name

optionalArguments.name: symbol
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract symbol

optionalArguments.name: uri
optionalArguments.description: The nft metadata uri

optionalArguments.name: approve
optionalArguments.description: A list of addresses to be approved to manage the NFT contract

optionalArguments.name: addOperator
optionalArguments.description: If true adds the Nevermined Transfer condition with permissions to mint NFTs

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: clone [nftAddress]
subcommands.description: It clones an existing NFT (ERC-1155) contract
subcommands.details: Nevermined Smart Contracts are deployed in a blockchain, with this command it's possible to clone the implementation of an already deployed Smart Contract. The new contract cloned will be owned by the user doing that clonning action.

positionalArguments.name: nftAddress
positionalArguments.description: The address of an already deployed ERC-1155 NFT contract

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract name

optionalArguments.name: symbol
optionalArguments.description: The nft contract symbol

optionalArguments.name: uri
optionalArguments.description: The nft metadata uri

optionalArguments.name: operators
optionalArguments.description: A list of addresses to be approved to operate the NFT contract

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: create
subcommands.description: Registers a new asset and associates a NFT (ERC-1155) to it
subcommands.details: This command registers a new asset that allows the publisher to provide access to some exclusive contents when users purchase the price of that NFT.
examples: ncli nfts1155 create 0xDef6F10d641BC9d8039365B27f4DF2C5F5eeb041 --name 'My NFT 1155' --author 'John Doe' --price 1 --urls https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 --contentType text/plain --cap 10 --royalties 5 --nftMetadata cid://QmVT3wfySvZJqAvkBCyxoz3EvD3yeLqf3cvAssFDpFFXNm

optionalArguments.name: metadata
optionalArguments.description: The path to the json file describing the NFT metadata

optionalArguments.name: nftMetadata
optionalArguments.description: The url (HTTP, IPFS, etc) including the NFT Metadata required by some marketplaces like OpenSea'

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: The asset name

optionalArguments.name: author
optionalArguments.description: The author of the file/s

optionalArguments.name: urls
optionalArguments.description: The asset urls. It can be a comma separated list of urls for multiple files.

optionalArguments.name: providers
optionalArguments.description: Public addresses of Node providers that user delegates some permissions.

optionalArguments.name: services
optionalArguments.description: The list of services attached to the asset

optionalArguments.name: type
optionalArguments.description: The type of asset to register (dataset, algorithm, workflow, container, subscription)

optionalArguments.name: license
optionalArguments.description: The asset license (Creative Commons, etc)

optionalArguments.name: price
optionalArguments.description: The NFT price

optionalArguments.name: cap
optionalArguments.description: The NFT minting cap (0 means uncapped)

optionalArguments.name: preMint
optionalArguments.description: If true the NFTs will be minted during creation

optionalArguments.name: transfer
optionalArguments.description: It allows to transfer a NFT when purchased or mint

optionalArguments.name: royalties
optionalArguments.description: The royalties (between 0 and 100%) to reward to the original creator in the secondary market

optionalArguments.name: publishMetadata
optionalArguments.description: Allows to store the metadata in the Metadata API only (metadata-api) or in IPFS too (passing ipfs as value here).

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: show [did]
subcommands.description: Retrieves information about a NFT
subcommands.details: For a given DID and NFT (ERC-1155) this command displays some information about it

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID associated with the NFT (tokenId)

optionalArguments.name: nftAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the NFT (ERC-721) contract

optionalArguments.name: show1155
optionalArguments.description: Show if there are any NFT ERC-1155 attached to the DID

subcommands.name: hold [did]
subcommands.description: It checks if an address is a holder of the NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to check if an address is a holder of a specific NFT wrapped by a Nevermined DID

optionalArguments.name: address
optionalArguments.description: The address of the account to validate as holder

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: balance [nftAddress] [did]
subcommands.description: It gets the balance of a NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to check if an address is a holder of a specific NFT wrapped by a Nevermined DID

optionalArguments.name: address
optionalArguments.description: The address of the account to get the balance

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: mint [did]
subcommands.description: Mints a ERC-1155 NFT
subcommands.details: This command allows to the owner of an asset to mint a ERC-1155 based NFT

optionalArguments.name: amount
optionalArguments.description: The number of NFTs (ERC-1155) to mint

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: burn [did]
subcommands.description: It Burns a ERC-1155 NFT
subcommands.details: It allows to a ERC-1155 NFT owner to burn it

optionalArguments.name: amount
optionalArguments.description: The number of NFTs (ERC-1155) to burn

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: order [did]
subcommands.description: Orders an NFT (ERC-1155) by paying for it to the escrow
subcommands.details: When a user orders an asset attached to a NFT, this command purchases that NFT and get it transferred to the wallet completing that purchase. This will allow later on to get access to the exclusive contents attached to the asset demonstrating the possesion of that NFT.

optionalArguments.name: amount
optionalArguments.description: The number of NFTs (ERC-1155) to burn

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: claim [agreementId]
subcommands.description: It allows to claim a NFT (ERC-1155) to the account of the buyer
subcommands.details: This command requires a valid `serviceAgreementId` created by the `buyerAccount` that demonstrates that an asset was payed. Having that this command will allow to transfer the asset to the buyer account.

positionalArguments.name: agreementId
positionalArguments.description: The identifier of the agreement created by the buyer

optionalArguments.name: sellerAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the seller (0x123..)

optionalArguments.name: buyerAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the account who will receive the NFT

optionalArguments.name: amount
optionalArguments.description: The number of NFTs (ERC-1155) to claim

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: access [did]
subcommands.description: Having a serviceAgreementId, it downloads the data associated to a ERC-1155 NFT
subcommands.details: Providing a `serviceAgreementId` this command will allow to download the file contents associated to a DID that has a NFT (ERC-721) as access control mechanism. If the account of the user executing this command hold the NFT, it will be able to download the files.

optionalArguments.name: agreementId
optionalArguments.description: The identifier of the agreement created by the buyer

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: The destination of the files downloaded

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

subcommands.name: download [did]
subcommands.description: As NFT holder this allows to download the files associated to a NFT
subcommands.details: This command will allow to purchase a NFT and download the file contents associated to a DID that has a NFT (ERC-721) as access control mechanism. If the account of the user executing this command hold the NFT, it will be able to download the files.

positionalArguments.name: did
positionalArguments.description: The DID asset identifier that works as tokenId for the NFT

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: The destination of the files

optionalArguments.name: nftType
optionalArguments.description: The NFT type

commands.name: utils
commands.description: Utility commands to faciliate files management, encryption, etc

subcommands.name: upload [file]
subcommands.description: Upload file to IPFS or Filecoin
subcommands.details: It uploads a local file to the decentralized storage network like IPFS or Filecoin. It returns a `CID` identifying that file into the storage network. If the `--password` flag is provided, it will encrypts the file before uploading it and will return the password used.

positionalArguments.name: file
positionalArguments.description: The path to the file to upload

optionalArguments.name: where
optionalArguments.description: The network where upload the file (ipfs or filecoin).

optionalArguments.name: encrypt
optionalArguments.description: If given it encrypts the file with AES and return password

subcommands.name: decrypt [file]
subcommands.description: Decrypt a file
subcommands.details: It decrypts a previously encrypted file using the password provided.

positionalArguments.name: file
positionalArguments.description: The path to the file to decrypt

positionalArguments.name: password
positionalArguments.description: The password to be used to decrypt the file

subcommands.name: encrypt [file]
subcommands.description: Encrypt a file
subcommands.details: It encrypts a file using the password provided.

positionalArguments.name: file
positionalArguments.description: The path to the file to encrypt

optionalArguments.name: password
optionalArguments.description: The password to be used to encrypt the file. If empty, a new password will be generated

subcommands.name: publish-nft-metadata
subcommands.description: It publish the metadata associated to a NFT into external storage
subcommands.details: The NFTs use some basic metadata allowing to some external Marketplaces to discover them and provide some additional information. This command allows to publish NFT metadata in the regular format supported by most popular marketplaces.
examples: ncli utils publish-nft-metadata --image https://www.artribune.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/2_Francisco-Goya-Saturno-devorando-a-su-hijos-1819-1823.jpg --name 'Saturn NFTs' --description 'Sturn eating his son' --externalUrl https://www.franciscogoya.com/saturn-devouring-his-son.jsp --animationUrl 'https://i1.wp.com/hyperallergic.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/goya-saturn-pigeons.gif?resize=470%2C470&quality=100' --royalties 1 --royaltiesReceiver 0x068ed00cf0441e4829d9784fcbe7b9e26d4bd8d0

optionalArguments.name: image
optionalArguments.description: URL to the image of the item

optionalArguments.name: name
optionalArguments.description: Name/title of the item

optionalArguments.name: description
optionalArguments.description: Description of the item. Markdown is supported

optionalArguments.name: externalUrl
optionalArguments.description: URL to the asset in a Nevermined ecosystem

optionalArguments.name: animationUrl
optionalArguments.description: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item

optionalArguments.name: youtubeUrl
optionalArguments.description: A URL to a YouTube video

optionalArguments.name: royalties
optionalArguments.description: Royalties for selling the NFT through a marketplace out of Nevermined (i.e OpenSea)

optionalArguments.name: royaltiesReceiver
optionalArguments.description: Address of the user receiving the royalties

subcommands.name: get-nft-metadata [did]
subcommands.description: Downloads the metadata associated to NFT
subcommands.details: The NFT Metadata is associated to the DID during the publication. This command allows to retrieve the url of that metadata and the content of it.

optionalArguments.name: nftAddress
optionalArguments.description: The address of the NFT contract

subcommands.name: download-artifacts [contractsVersion]
subcommands.description: Downloads the Nevermined Contracts artifacts
subcommands.details: Nevermined exposes the Smart Contracts artifacts with their definition. Also Nevermined record all the different versions of these contracts deployed in different networks ready to be downloaded. Depending on the parameters provided, this command allows to download them.

positionalArguments.name: contractsVersion
positionalArguments.description: Version of the artifacts to download. For example 2.0.0

optionalArguments.name: networkId
optionalArguments.description: The networkId of the network where Nevermined contracts are deployed and we want to download the artifacts. For example 'mumbai' is 80001

optionalArguments.name: tag
optionalArguments.description: The tag name of the contracts artifacts to download

optionalArguments.name: destination
optionalArguments.description: The destination folder for the artifacts to download. For example /tmp

subcommands.name: clean-artifacts
subcommands.description: Removes all the previously downloaded and cached artifacts
subcommands.details: The CLI stores a local copy of the Smart Contracts artifacts into a local folder. This command deletes this cached copy.

optionalArguments.name: path
optionalArguments.description: The folder where are the artifacts to clean. For example /tmp
